title: Billie Eilish, 17, cuts a typically edgy figure as she films Carpool Karaoke with James Corden
text:
She is one of the most successful artists in the world at just 17 years old.

And Billie Eilish followed in the footsteps of music greats including Celine Dion, Stevie Wonder and Adele as she filmed Carpool Karaoke with James Corden for The Late Late Show in LA on Tuesday.

The Bad Guy hitmaker cut a typically edgy figure in an oversized black and white block print sweater paired with baggy joggers as she walked along chatting with James, 41.

Up next: Billie Eilish followed in the footsteps of music greats including Celine Dion, Stevie Wonder and Adele as she filmed Carpool Karaoke with James Corden for The Late Late Show in LA on Tuesday

Teen talent: The Bad Guy hitmaker, 17, cut a typically edgy figure in an oversized black and white block print sweater paired with baggy joggers as she walked along

She finished her ensemble with black trainers adorned with silver studs and silver laces.

Her lime and black locks were styled sleek and straight as she was spotted belting out some tracks with James in the car.

Gavin & Stacey star James looked casually cool in a navy tee, jeans and trainers as he took his seat next to the superstar, ahead of filming the wildly popular segment.

Earlier this month Billie appeared on Howard Stern's radio show where she discussed reaching success at such a young age, her first song Ocean Eyes achieved mainstream success when she was just 14.

Quirky: Her lime and black locks were styled sleek and straight as she was spotted walking with host James

'There's a part of me that feels I did miss being a teenager, a normal more,' she said. 'But more and more I get more grateful for it happening that young.'

'I feel like if it had happened later then people would be able to dig up dirt from when I was that age,' she said.

Billie also revealed 'I don't know what to expect anymore because I thought everyone would hate Bad Guy and everyone would hate When The Party's Over.

Bad Guy went on to reach number one on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart, after debuting at number seven. She became the first artist born in the 2000's to reach number one and the youngest since Lorde reached the spot at 16 in 2013.

She is currently wrapping up her 66-date When We Fall Asleep World Tour. Billie has already announced her second headlining world tour, Where Do We Go World Tour, that will begin in March 2020 and will go for 43 dates.

Sing song: Gavin & Stacey star James looked casually cool in a navy tee, jeans and trainers as he took his seat next to the superstar, ahead of filming the wildly popular segment

It was announced on Tuesday that she nabbed six MTV EMA nominations after winning three MTV VMA's earlier this year.

But Billie isn't the only family member making a name for herself.

Last week, Selena Gomez released her new break-up ballad about her past love with Justin Bieber called Lose You To Love Me, and Billie's brother Finneas helped produce the track.

'It was really cool [to work with him.] It actually kind of happened last minute.' she said while on SiriusXM's Hits 1 with hosts Symon and Tony Fly.

'We were finishing up the song, and he's at the same label as I am, along with Billie, and they played him the song. They said 'hey, do you think you can add something to it?' And he was so kind to say, 'absolutely.'

'He just added that final touch, and it really made a difference, from the second chorus to what he did in the bridge,' the Love You Like a Love Song singer added.

'It was really awesome.'
description: Billie Eilish followed in the footsteps of music greats including Celine Dion, Stevie Wonder and Adele as she filmed Carpool Karaoke with James Corden for The Late Late Show in LA on Tuesday.
